body.p:
Georgetown 8 August 1864
Gov. Thos E. Bramlette
Dear Sir -- The continuance and increase of the guerillas in the hills in this northern part of Scott and adjoining counties render this place in deadly danger.
They have arranged several times to make a raid upon us but were prevented by the presence of troops sent for the purpose
Under an order by Genl. Burbridge we have offered and enrolled all the citizens of the town to be drilled armed and just in readiness for the defence.
We are without arms & were directed to apply to you to furnish the Town with 100 Ballard Carbines with ammunition if in your power from the State Arsenal

They shall be taken care of and returned and will be of great value to us at this moment. We have some arms belonging to individuals which will be
used and with these we ask will arm from 150 to 200 new enrolled member
I think the organization a good one and will increase the defence of the town against these bands of Robbers & Guerillas. Please answer at your earliest convenience
Let the arms be issued give instructions how to get them

Ky State Guard.
Georgetown Scott Co. Ky.
August 8th 1864.
Robinson Hon. Jas F.

To the Gov. Stating that Georgetown is clearly in danger of a guerlla raid. Under an order from Genl Burbridge the citizens have been offered and enrolled for its defence. This letter has been referred by Gov. Bramlette with this endorsement thereon "Inspector Genl let the arms be issued -- give instructions how to get them"
Blanks forwarded and communication answered on this Aug. 9-64 on Letter book B. Page 20
Scott Co. & surrounding counties in danger
